text:
Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
I was a very unorganized place, where full-time employees would take advantage of summer students and make then do all the dirty work. The job wasn't very rewarding.
City of Ottawa is always well managed and salary is always amazing. I highly recommend this job. You will make lifetime friends and enjoy going to work everyday.

Although the City Of Ottawa is an amazing company to work with to get guaranteed hours and access to on-site benefits, the management leaves something to be desired as they do not act with their employee's best interest at heart.
It was a good experience, meeting new people everyday. I made a lot of friends the good thing was it’s an outdoor pool which is great and I could ask for a better summer than that.
Hardest part is the working outdoors in winter.  Staff are wonderful and supportive.  Pay for the position is fair and reasonable but not full time or permanent

This was a very demanding position that brought on it's own issues.  As a Councillor's Assistant job security is not great and it is difficult to move to a position within the city because you are not a unionized employee.

Working frontline has many challenges. You are regularly interacting with families in crisis and must deal the with issues they have in a professional manner.  There are physical components to the job, moving and lifting as well as time on your feet.  Administratively there are Log Books, Narratives and Incident reports to complete as needed. It is also shift work.

Management was very experienced and very supportive. They stood behind their employees 100%. Opportunities to gain new certifications/qualifications were ample, team building on a regular basis. Loved the job.
Volunteering for the city of Ottawa was very beneficial in allowing me to contribute to the community. I learned skills in being responsible and taking initiative during my time there.

A typical day required mandatory cleanliness of the park and the inside of the pool. I learned relationships and boundaries; understanding and accommodating to the needs of the patrons and of my job requirements as well as myself. The job teaches you a lot about people and yourself and is a good experience for teens who need a first time job. The security of the job is also a good thing because it takes the stress away from having to find a new job every year. The people you work with as well, help you build relationships and partnerships through and with people in the City of Ottawa.

working at OC Transpo is a great place to work. You meet so many people on a daily basis if you are interested in working in a customer service style environment. Working environment is great. you get to choose your schedule to work around your personal / social life.

I worked many different jobs with the City, but I can honestly say, it was always fun coming into work. Even if you knew no one on your shift, everyone was friendly and my management team was always so accommodating, friendly and understanding.

Worked alongside a great team 
Duties included:
Supervising children from grades 1-6 in after school program 
Lead sports and art activities
Responsible for the organization of materials and clean up 
Liaise with parents at pick up
Friendly environment for kids and staff members

The city of ottawas transit sector is a great place to work, flexible hours and great pay as well as benifits! However with the new changes introducing the LRT, they are laying off hundreds of operators that could be of more benifit to the company then the ones who are soon to be retiring.

can be a fun company to work for if you're a makeup lover. Pay is a little bit higher than its competitors in the Makeup Retail Industry and there's always an opportunity to network and meet different people. As permanent artist both part time and full time, you get gifts and perks --lots of free makeup (gratis) from the company, as well as a %60 discount on product purchase. Keep in mind that perks ar

Great team. Very welcoming and productive. Learned how to be more open with the public, be more organized by filing documents and placing them in the right folder. I also got to work with the childcare department and was able to key-in many applications.

Worked at the City of Ottawa for approximately 30 years and as such there were good times and bad. Over the years I held various positions including ward clerk and equipment trainer, the latter of which I enjoyed greatly.

One senior colleague put it as the "golden handcuffs".  If you are in operations, it is a reasonable steady pace employment with good work life balance.  If you are in any management support role, it's a place of dead space, frustratingly ineffective.  There is still a lot of 50's style management dinosaurs around in some departments and career advancement rely highly on who you know and not so much on ability.  Job competitions are a sham, the successful candidate are often predetermined, the interviews are just going through the motions to legitimize the award.

good
work hours 
salary

The city of Ottawa is a great job to work at. The people are amazing and easy to talk and confide in. They are always there to help whenever its needed. They offer a wide variety of training which is all paid for.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

The City of Ottawa has many perks and overall is a great employer.  However, the officer culture was quite toxic and I was ostracized by management.  As a temp employee you have zero job security despite paying union dues, and it can take 2 years to get permanency.  Before that time you can be terminated for any and no reason with no grievance process, again paying union dues. 
Training was awful and incredibly short, however, my manager gave no leeway in terms of mistakes.  My manager targeted me and my employment was doomed.  Terrible experience that has left me considering moving from Ottawa so i dont have to contribute to the City. 
Phone aspect of the job was awful and involved being a human punching bag for the City's inflexible and expensive policies.
pros: overtime, good salary, nice perks (compressed work day, 1.5 hours break)
cons: awful managers, awful training, little job security until you are permanent

text: Great place to work as it was fun, paid well, and was perfect for students since the events occurred on the weekends. The work involved removing waste from customers cars and placing it at the appropriate table where other workers would dispose of it.

Strong high-level board of directors including: Ottawa Police, Ottawa Community Housing, United Way, City Councillors etc.  Small staff team focused on creating and enhancing strategic partnerships to impact community safety.   Little to no room for advancement.
Great Enviornment and Great people to work with. I have learned a lot about how the department works and the overall role that I play within the department.

I thoroughly enjoy working for the City of Ottawa. However, there are some considerations:
- It's a safe job, therefore many employees are incredibly lazy
- Management must trudge through a mountain of red tape to change anything.
- Don't have hopes of changing much or being appropriately recognized for going the extra mile.
With the union, the City does take care of its employees:
- Great counselling resources
- Adequate (sometimes slow-to-respond) compensation.
- Benefits
- Seniority system that rewards tenure and experience
- Protected and limited liability.
It takes a special personality type to enjoy a long-term career with the City. If you are ambitious and want a competitive career, look to the private sector. However, if you want a clear-cut, safe, protected, and transparent job, the City is perfect for you.
cons: Lazy staff, Red Tape, Cheap, Slow, Socially agonizaing

text: It used to be a fantastic place to work, however, the management has all changed.  Old managers were forced to retire or transferred out to make room for new management.  This has changed the environment and moral greatly.  They have continued to hire unqualified drivers and blame them even though it is a lack of training and support.  I feel bad for new recruits.  As a senior driver, the work shifts have worsened since I started.  No time for family.  No longer encourages and supports career advancement.  Benefits are superb.  Salary is superb.
Solid organization to work for. Can be long wait to earn permanent positions but all in all the benefits, vacation and people are all pretty easy going. Would recommend working for this organization.

The  job is a good job. I prefer a position where I use my head more as opposed to just a daily routine. Although there are days where a great deal of problem solving is required. Te salary is good as well as the benifits.
Good training with the city to learn the ins and outs of working with the public. Very easy going and works hard to help you in difficult situations. Wonderful experience overall.
Had a very good time, a really great time. Wasn't afraid to get wet when I had to. Still tried not to get wet on multiple occasions when I really just wanted to be dry.

-Great part-time job
-Possibility of training and moving up
-Flexible hours
-Fun environment
-Ability to use the facility to workout, swim for free
pros: Great salary, free access to the pool and gym

text: At the City of Ottawa Archives, I learned how to catalogue records into a database. In terms of management, the employees were all treated fairly. Everyone was nice to each other! The hardest part of the job was when my computer would freeze. The most enjoyable part of the job was the great balance I had with working, socializing, and taking a walk.

-Very punctual 
-Learned to effectively handle any customer service concerns 
-Experienced in teaching all levels and ages 
-Acquired an understanding for class discipline
-Assisted in a successfully handled major  
-Organizing pool ran camps as well as camp counselling
Did not enjoy the pool environment
The people, the management, the flexible/set hours. everything about working for the city is so much fun. Everyone was so nice and enthusiastic about their jobs.

I got to work with great people, although some locations may be different atmospheres. Pay was good until the minimum wage went up. I got to learn how road infrastructure works and how hard city workers work. They provide all the training, and most of it can carry over to other job opportunities.
Workplace culture was always friendly and acceptable. I was given lots of responsibility and always felt as though I was trusted. The most enjoyable part of the job was working with children

Enjoyable work experience, with many opportunities to learn through on the job training, various committee meetings and networking. 
Great place to learn about municipal government.
.

Great for a high school job or to get through university but hours are limited and there is no minimum shift length so you can be asked to come in for one hour which sucks. Pay is also not very good since minimum wage went up and the city did not increase wages at all.

I enjoyed working this job as it was flexible enough to work around my full time job. I got to enjoy times with young children and be active! I would be careful though if you get told verbally that you could have a job the following year as I had that happen then just recently they said that the full-time position was most likely not going to be open.
Since there is so many business lines, there is lots of opportunities at the City of Ottawa.  From administration, finance, HR, IT, health, engineering, skills trades, etc. etc.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
I was working with the City of Ottawa in Infrastructure group as a Summer Student. I worked on many various projects, including Innes Road Widening. Staff, and Experience was excellent!
Good part time job for students because of the flexible hours that can accommodate for a busy student schedule. Minimum wage job but it usually isn't that busy (depending on your complex)
pros: 30 min break, great coworkers, great management, lots of shifts available

text:
No work day is typical - while there are regularities, there is always a new experience to be had. It's never boring, there are always tasks to be performed and patrons/clients to get to know. 
Apart from it being the perfect student job due to the flexible hours, there is the fact that part-time staff aren't allowed to work enough hours (up to 24). In the current economy, this isn't sustainable.
pros: Flexible work hours, paid recertifications, fun and exciting work environment
cons: Not enough work hours, current wages don't match qualification requirements

text:
There are plenty of advancement opportunities, people are great, management and supervisors are involved and always around to help when needed. 
Mature work environment, with respect all around. 
Scheduling is flexible in that you are permitted to switch shifts as much as you want and with proper notice vacations and appointments are easy to schedule. 
Overall a healthy work environment that promotes a work life balance and health both physical and mental.

It was a great place to work and i really enjoyed myself, however I was looking for something with more hours. During my time with the city I worked as a program leader and coordinator for multiple programs.
Strong stepping stone for students in an area with lots of different opportunities to present. The diversity in jobs makes it a truly flexible working environment.

I began as a summer student and was immediately accepted as part of this professional, yet dynamic team. The initial learning curve was steep, but once the concepts understood very easy to grow and develop.
I enjoyed working here and had the opportunity to get a hands on experience. I am happy that I had a chance to work here and it opened my view toward a lot of new things.

City of Ottawa job is amazing place to work for.  They have excellence life balance, salary with benefits.  It is very respectful environment that whenever you have problem, they looking to help you out.
Awesome crew to work with, never a dull moment and always busy. Going around fixing up the city you live in is always nice to get paid to do and people are friendly.

My time with the City of Ottawa was one of great development in skills like Leadership and Teamwork; I learned to communicate effectively with Students, Patrons, and Co-workers. All of the managers I had the opportunity to work with lead great teams and kept our wellbeing and growth as a high priority.

Your daily routine with any job city of Ottawa job is to turn up at your shift and do the work that has been assigned to you by your supervisor. The staff are generally understanding when you have questions about the work or training and will guide you down the path of most success. From my experience there have been a few miscommunications between the office and employees in my position, other than that it is an amazing place to work!

I was really looking forward to working for the city of ottawa until I started working there. I was a special needs support worker and I barley got any support from the others staff. There was time where I went the whole day without eating because I had to helped my kids eat because they were unable to do so which is fine that is my job but it would have been nice if i was offered asome help so I could eat my food as well

As a Building Inspector you would start your day at 7am
Take all of of daily calls and proceed to book your day in order to 
star the process of going to each location for the purpose of make sure that the work that was being inspected by you meet the Ontario Building Code. 
You learn how to work along , prepare reports etc..
The management will not have your back on several occasion
The work place culture is changing very fast due to the new technologies coming out each year 
Make sure that your on site decision with not be disputed by management
The most enjoyable part of the job, is to see someone happy that you have made a on site decision
cons: Management refusing to change with the times

text:
Not enough training provided when asked for.
Depending on management, career growth is either blocked or supported.
The City offers such broad services that it allows you to jump around departments and learn new things about the City.
It's a wonderful place to work if you're looking to stay in a position for a long time. I have been able to work at several locations doing various jobs which is great experience.

Intersting job, important work i enjoy working here and helping th clients.
Hours are good and plenty of shifts.
I have learnt alot .
Phone call assesments are challenging
Management was amazing and everyone was very welcoming and helpful when it came to my job perfomance. I really enojyed working with the kids and running activities with the other staff.

Lifeguard/ Swim instructor
Good pay
Good training
Benefits
Safe and fun environment
Lots of work and credentials required
Overall good job to have as a student

This place is really a great place to work. The benefits are pretty good. Management is ok. However I find it not progressive at all. They rely mostly on consultants so less opportunities for full time employees to get quality work. Politics is all over the place like any other public sector organization which sometimes kills the merit.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
Everything is well managed and organized. Everyone is always willing to lend a helping hand and you make close ties with the clients, as well as your coworkers.
I am not typical, I look to strive and better myself on a daily basis.  With so many employees and so little opportunity of moving forward my future looked unsatisfied.

Working with the City of Ottawa has been a great experience for me. While exploring multiple different aspect of my area of interest, I acquired a lot of experience working with multiple diverse groups. I would love to get more involved in the area as well.

little shifts, its more of a seasonal kind of job.. shifts are not always available. The working environment can sometimes be harsh because we hand out flyers during winter for 2 hours before we get a break. Funny enough that's when the job's availability is more

A good day at work 40 hrs a week 
always good people to work for 
Good envoriment to work 
The management are good employees
The 40 hrs a week is a good thing 
Everybody gets along
A typical shift at work consisted of teaching my student. It was a great experience that helps me develop my sense of leadership and determination. The workplace was in a nice environment
The city of Ottawa offers a great work life balance, they have very supportive managers and wish want their employees to succeed. There are often many jobs available.
Depending on what department you work in, things will be different. In the receivables/collections part it was a mostly older women who are generally 'catty' for the most part. Much fun.

Unionized, fairly and clearly compensated, clear responsibility RE: replacing shifts and picking up shifts, fun environment, ample training leading up to hiring, good team dynamic (if sometimes a little cliquey - this is a teen job, after all).
Really good job for students. Get an immersive experience into laboratories world + getting a valuable network. Only available to University student within the field.

Great training programs, and people with a great chance to produce into a career.
I would recommend this to anyone who can get the chance. 
City of Ottawa
great bunch of people to work with and to work for. work life balance is ideal and excellent retirement benefits including pension plan. modern IT work place
People are very friendly and the community is all connected allowing us to stay interactive with each other and help each other when a shift is needed.

good casual job that pays well.
Interesting client population ans services that are offered to clients.
Very busy job and opportunities for learning.
enjoyable.
A typical day at work takes a level of focus that must be maintained as long as you are getting paid for.Its easy to do as long as you are used to it. Its fun working!

It can be a great place to work. Can be difficult at times to advance. Very stagnant culture. Slow paced and bureaucratic. Pay is great for the type of work being performed but can become very boring and mundane.
Being a camp instructor the most rewarding job that I have ever had. I love coming into work, it always puts a smile on my face. I always look forward to my next shift.

At times I did not have anything to do and many of the tasks I was assigned were not very meaningful. I truly found out what a "government job" was. I took another co-op opportunity (I was a student at the time) and a 10 $/hr pay decrease to get out of there.

the City of Ottawa is a great place to begin you're working career. You gain valuable workplace knowledge and develop great relationships with co-workers. Overall, it's a very positive environment, and I would recommend working for the city.

Although there is a lot of standing around, it is the best part of the job. You almost feel as though you're not doing anything. I learn a lot from the In-Services. How to treat injuries, how to speak to certain groups of people. Management was great! I loved how they were all so young and easy to relate with. Diverse group of workers. Hardest part of the job was being in the heat in 30+ humidity under a tiny umbrella if you're lucky, but it was manageable. My favorite  part of the job was all the friendships I made after doing this job for 2 years. I loved working here.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
this job was a lot of fun as it was pretty much just make sure the ice is clean and safe then, you get to play hockey and get paid. overall very fun job.

working for the City of Ottawa provides steady employment with some basic benefits. Internal Job postings allow for movement to other positions. The salary is low, even at the top end and there are only so many higher up positions.

I worked programs with the city such as soccer,hockey and other activities. I was then offered a job at a pool. My first 3 months were good then my boss went crazy and started over demanding. I do not recommend working more than 2 shifts a week.

This is a great job if you are a student as they are very flexible with hours. You can choose not to work set hours for several months and stay on the replacement staff list.  However, shifts are set for different sessions. This also gives you the opportunity to have different positions within the City of Ottawa.
cons: not enough hours, can't leave location on breaks

text: Work environment is pleasant and provides good opportunities for advancement. The work culture is very dynamic and collaboration between all departments is great.
cons: Subject to Council decisions which may impact job security

text: If you love working with children and have a fun and dynamic personality, this is the job for you! Work with kids of all ages and teach them various skills through play!
The city of Ottawa was a great work environment to work in. Supervisors are friendly but firm and help ensure everything is going smoothly. Decent place to work.

Was one of my again favourite places to work great staff back in the day, sure had certain clicks but over all got along with everyone and had my on clicks as well. Lost touch with most of the people sometimes bump into a few but its been years I hope all is well with all of the staff from 2001 to 2003.
Unionized work, hours based on seniority, subsidized training. Great framework for lifeguards looking to be in it for the long run. Excellent facilities and teams.
With tones of other staff to help you out with any difficulty, and the ability to request hours at your own choice. The city of Ottawa is a great place to work.

Great Summer job, enjoyed the experience, great training, staff was good to work with.  Had contract extended into the fall and their recommendation helped get me a job with the Ottawa Humane Society over the winter!
Great place to work. Co-workers are friendly and very easy to work with. The most enjoyable part of the job is working with kids. I learned how to take control of some situations.

Poor management leading to poor workplace culture.
Male-centric management, self-obsessed.
Catastrophically risk adverse.
Technology adverse - IT group won't allow for any customization nor use of any non-standard software.
pros: HR payroll always provided a correct paycheck - on-time.
cons: Non-unionized staff have short life spans, easily dismissed.

text: Great pay and benefits. Terrible management. Helps if you know someone to get you in permanent, Not what you know its all about who you know. Great co workers
Always looked forward to coming into work and was always around fun people. Advancement was always available if wanted, co-workers showed the same work ethic.
working here is good but they don't hire full time right away so makes it hard if you have kids or a mortgage to pay, salary was good people were okay. this was a good job

As it is with the City of Ottawa, it makes it very hard to get fired or lose your position. The job itself is fairly easy but includes a lot of memory and knowledge. 
The management keeps switching as they get promoted and get replaced which makes it very hard to get along with them. Some seem unorganized and can sometimes affect your job. 
With the city of Ottawa, you need to be bilingual which could be a con for some.
An extremely rewarding job as youre always with children. Great employes, a very positive work place with extremely understading bosses. They're always there to assist you with anything

In my position I helped supervise municipal pools where kids could play.  Though the work was simple, the responsibility was rather high.  The long moments standing in the sun at prescribed locations always made one wonder why we weren't allowed to sit like lifeguards who work indoors.
Good employment, originally got hired as a summer student then under casual contract i the winter. Long shifts made up with lots of time off. Room for advancement

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

I worked in two departments.  The first was great... interesting work, great people to work with, overall environment was friendly and not stressful at all.  Second department I worked in was a great place to work but management would never give you a straight answer when it came to becoming a permanent employee
cons: Management made you play a guessing game to whether you had a job or not at the end of the week

text:
Management was good
Pay was good
Environment was laid-back & fun
Employees were great to work with & friendly
Good work/life balance
Part-time & Full-time employment
I love working for the City of Ottawa. I learned to get along with coworkers, dealing with customers, and I grew as a person. I learned that customers are always right and to respect their wishes.
productive days, with management support.  hardest part and most enjoyable part is isolating and managing change avenues.  wide scope of learning if you work for it
Very hard to make the cut.There is lots of training but overall the hours are nice,the benefits and pay are excellent..................................
It was a good work environment in which you were able to work independently and learn good team skills. I would recommend for anyone to apply and work there
Relaxed environment that brings you closer to the community. Its easy when you finish training and you don't require much supervision. The pay is steady and shifts are reliable.
Days at work are very long but there is always learning curves and new knowledge obtained every single day. Good staff and tons of training for every situation. Overall great place to work.

withing the city of ottawa, specifically being a lifeguard and swim instructor was a good job when i was 16-18. As i got older i was primarily working with younger people which created a very isolated work environment. 
Management was young adults who often didn't know how to act appropriatly in the work place and towards the people "working" for them.
The job paid well however there are two different rates for lifeguarding and teaching swimming lessons. if you are interested in teaching swimming lessons you are looking at working only evenings and weekends.

Working at the city was amazing. It had great hours as well as my coworkers were all respectful.
There is no better place to work then the city of Ottawa.

-Caring management
-Productive environment
-Acquired many valuable skills
-Opportunities for advancement
-Great coworkers
-Work life balance
-Work could be monotonous

I've been working with the city for 3 years, and I have to say that I've had tons of fun working there. Working as a before care and after care counselor was never a job I would've seen myself doing, but having done it, I'd recommend it to just about anyone who's looking for a first job. Being around kids allows for a fun, fast paced work environment. It's also a great way to improve your communication skills and meet new people. My only complaint would be the lack of hours...
pros: Easy job if you enjoy being around children

text: Worked 12 hour shifts cleaning sidewalks in the city of Ottawa was a fun spot to work and really enjoyed it but only worked when I got called in which was very hard to deal with and never got called back for the next year which was disappointing.

The lifeguard/swim instructor position offers a lot of good hours and flexible scheduling for a student who wants to work. Getting paid above minimum wage for fun work with like-minded young adults is great.
I like working there. always work hard with enthusiasm. want more hours and jobs for making money. I handle cash and talk and help customers with anything they need.

Lifeguard training consisted of the following: 
● Contact emergency medical personnel in case of serious injury
● Monitor pool area for violations and potential hazardous situations
● Assist in maintaining pool and recreation areas clean
● Examine injured individuals, administer first aid
The job was fun. I spent most of my days going to different areas in the city to make sure everything was in order. However, the people were the highlight and they were amazing to work with
The gymnasium offers lots of different activities and sports equipment to give you all the materials you need to run proper fun activities for the kids.

Worked great with school as shifts  did not conflict with class times.
Barely  higher than  minimum  wage.
Is ideal as  a part-time student  position.
Working in the recreation sector with the City of Ottawa was a perfect way to gain work experience and develop professional skills throughout high school and university.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

I  directed, allocated and coordinated the day to day tasks of designated of personnel and ensured the quality & quantity of output to achieve directed
standards Petrie Island City of Ottawa public beach, Met deadlines according to the published schedules, Performed building/washroom maintenance, Managed the volleyball/paddle board as a rental associate/Cash handling.
Would have liked more hours at the Rec Centre, not much time spent there. Great staff and fun place to work. Easy contact with supervisor, always friendly and available

As much as I enjoyed the location that I worked at, I felt very overworked for my pay rate. There is also little room for advancement in the job sector. The staff was lovely, but the job just wasn't worth it. 
Downsides:
pros: Great staff, great location, good community feel
cons: Little room for advancement, Very little staff to take shifts from you, Low pay rate, Not enough hours

text:
Working as a volunteer for a City of Ottawa summer camps includes collaborating with a team of coordinators to create a fun and exciting environments for youth, such as planning indoor and outdoor activities, exciting games, field trips and outings. 
It's a fun summer camp for the kids, and also a fun job for the camp counselors.

Good and bad feelings. Work days seem to take up the whole day and leave no room for evening activities. Management makes unadvised decisions without reason. Good working with kids and good staff in a safe environnement

Get to work with a a great team in a small office that is set up well with great managment.  Constantly getting to work on differnt tasks and inproving my skill levels. would love a slightly more fast pased location but enjoy a bit of quiet time to do cleaning a reorganizing of the office.
pros: Enjoy the working with differnt projects and great people.

text: At first it seemed like the day would never end with you in a chair all day just looking at a computer screen but as soon as you get to know the staff and realize how easy of a job it is you appreciate the long hours you've worked
work restrictions are placed upon people in order to move forward , management does not encourage people to advance in the work force . tough environment to work in

This is a great job for potential officer of the law to learn the daily routines, report writing and dealing with the population. I learned how to calmly get through a heated discussion with an individual, I know to keep the high emotions at bay so that rational decisions can be made

Although the hours are a bit frustrating to work around, I had an excellent experience working for the city. They allowed me to gain a lot of experience in public relations and personal responsibility.

I was only here for a short time but I enjoyed working here, the other staff were friendly and accepting, and we all seemed to work okay together though we all had different styles in how to handle things.

Great work environment for young people. Coworkers are often similar minded people who are always willing to help out. Employees are for the most part very skilled in their area of expertise and provide services to the best of their abilities.

Administrer les medicaments aux patients selon les prescription du Doctor et se rassurer que tous les patients sont traites avec dignite et respect, sans discrimination. Entretenir de bonnes relations avec les patient afin de faciliter la therapie( nurse -patient relationships).
Se rassurer que les psw font leur travail de facon appropriee. Repondre aux questions posees par la famille des patients, cette situation est assez stressante car certaines familles sont trop exigentes. Reporter des incidents à l,infirmiere en charge, ces infirmieres/infirmiers sont toujours prêts à aider et le font avec plaisir
ceci rend l,admosphere agreable.
I found the place very fun. I liked the complexity part of the job. I learned a lot about change of ownership, new applications: vtax, Aquacis, MAP, AMR, etc.

Everything about the City of Ottawa is amazing
Salary Vacations and work expectations.
I would reccomend government employment to anybody.  Yay Defined Benefit Pensions

Management supported the opportunity to advance my knowledge within my work environment. 
Great place to work for all Ethnic backgrounds.
A gym was on site for those who wished to participate.

A typical day at work includes monitoring parks and recreational areas while awaiting calls. Once a call was received we would go inspect the incident or in the case of a high priority call intervene to properly deal with the issue at hand. By-Law Officers deal with all things that are not criminal but can be fined. Such as noise complaints, excess debris, snow removal, etc. I learned how to appropriately and professionally communicate with the public, how to manage time effectively and how to deal with stressful situations. The hardest part of the job was not knowing whether or not a call or individual would be dangerous, therefore, you would go into most situations blindly. However, this was worth it due to the satisfaction you receive from helping the public and cleaning up the city.
My work consisted of cataloguing or re-cataloguing items that had been transferred. I found the environment to be a bit too quiet, not a lot of interaction with other staff or patrons.

The City of Ottawa is generally a depressing place to work. The majority of the departments are filled with disinterested government workers looking to grow the size of their department. There is essentially no sense of purpose in the management and the students generally consider the entire process as a joke. Although The hours and pay was good, I can't help but feel guilty wasting taxpayers money in a clearly unproductive sector. 
Cut the student program, have students work in the private sector in the summer and actually accomplish something. I feel dirty just thinking about it.
You are just an employee number.  I found a very large disconnect from management down to the frontline workers. Management has really no idea of what the job of an Operator is.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
I've been with the city of Ottawa for 2 years now and starting on my 3rd. Each year I come back it just keeps getting better. It's a full-time job, but it's definitely worth it.

I have worked for the City of Ottawa for two years. It is a great place to work because of the steady hours and great employees. I really enjoyed working within the traffic program and I have learned very much.

Focused on new programs and initiatives to develop employees including but not limited to language training, employee mentorship, training in technical areas. The City offers a wide range of career choices in several disciplines and as such there is always the potential to switch careers.
I enjoyed volunteering at the Cyrville Community Centre. The staff were encouraging and understanding and campers were great to work with. I would recommend it to others.

My experience working for the City of Ottawa has been quite beneficial. They incorporate many opportunities and I have learned many skills while working for the City of Ottawa. They have prepared me well with trainings and additional information about my job. Overall, I would recommend working with the City of Ottawa.
pros: Paid training and realistic expected work hours.

text: I worked for the City of Ottawa as a rink supervisor under the authority of a community leader. The City of Ottawa provided the tools necessary and helped to organize both community events and was appreciative of our work in the community. As an employee of Dovercourt Recreation Centre, the city provided much of the summer camps funding and helped to shape program creation. As far of supervision or direct involvement, I understand the city provided the funds and requirements, but allowed us the operational flexibility to program our own camps to cater to our clientele. In conclusion, the City has been a fine employer and patron.
pros: Flexible work hours, knowledgeable program staff

text: Good place to work in the summer time. I have great respect for the city of ottawa they treat everyone fairly and honestly and their expectations are always clear.
Gained valuable experience in the customer service industry in the public sector. Developed problem solving skills, multitasking skills and customer relations skills.

The workplace is incredibly friendly, everyone is happy and willing to pass down years of knowledge and experience with new and student employees. Their GIS department is interesting and it was fun getting to work with all the data in their Enterprise Databases.
A typical at work involve teaching classes and then guarding a free swim. I was always learning at work and improving my swimming skills. The workplace culture was very positive and supportive.

Best job any kid in high school who plays hockey could ask for. I supervised and maintained a local ice hockey rink after school from 4pm-10pm. Hardest part of the job was quitting. Most enjoyable was playing hockey with my friends for 6 hours and getting paid to do so.

Driving and getting people from the out lying areas of Ottawa to the downtown core. Keeping my bus on schedule and making the passengers happy by being on time and getting them to their destination safely.
pros: freedom of being on the road, being my own boss while in charge of my bus.great benefits.working with the public.

text: good experience, lots to learn especially for people who have not worked in politics before. Politics has less job security but is more exciting (events, socializing etc) . Good luck !
cons: working with a lot of people who have complaints about the city

text: good place to work . nice people and nice environment to work in. hours are pretty flexible and is not a demanding job. working for the city of ottawa is a good idea

Working with the City of Ottawa was very beneficial for me. I learnt a lot of new skills such as SAP, inventory control, accounts payable/receivable etc. Management was really friendly and encouraged their employees to excel in the workplace and learn new things. Overall, a wonderful experience!
Having to stay attentive and make responsible choices to prevent injury is the most important aspect to my job. Dealing with customer service issues and customer service payments and registrations.
Management and employees were always in a great mood. Got to be a big influence to kids, which was very rewarding. It was a fun place to work because of the games and constant fun

I had a great time with the instructors and kids and learnt a lot form my experience. There were many aspects about the job that made me enjoy the idea of continuing down a path into leadership employment, especially with children, because it allows you to learn responsibility and care giving as well as being flexible and understanding considering we dealt with the very young kids.

Everyday I would go in at 7, then we would sit and wait for the Zone Supervisor to give us orders of what we were going to be doing tat day. Learned a lot about different machines, and the safety of being around them. Good place to work, everyone was nice.

Working as a parks programmer is great.  You work closely with a team of generally 6 or 7 people.  management is fantastic and there is a lot of training and making sure you feel confident with the tasks at hand.
cons: no work if it rains no formal break hours

text:
Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
Always a positive atmosphere.  Happy customers. Occasional work parties. The bosses where always looking out for the workers.

My typical work days involves interacting and playing games with children. I absolutely love this job because I get payed to play. The management of this job is fantastic because it provides me with the time to work while attending school.
Presently I work at Long term care, at this type of facilities a strong team work is required in order to achieve the maximum results wich are the wellbeing of the residents.

If ever given the chance to work for the City of Ottawa, you should. Any position has great job security and a well-structured management. Most jobs requiring experience pay well. Internal hiring for jobs is the most important perk of working for the city,

Greet clients and sign in appointment, maintain file room, support case coordinators.
Workplace is fun, friendly and has a supportive team and management.

bon collaborateurs 
avantages sociaux 
acces facile par raport au transport

Jack Purcell Community Centre was the place I did volunteering work before I got a part-time employment there as a summer job in the year 2008.
I could not complain anything because this place gave me lot of opportunities to get connected with people and lot of fun to work with.

The job starts off with a great training weekend where you get to meet many of the new staff you will be working with. You learn how to maintain the pool, how to perform first aid in a pool setting, and how your specific community pool runs. You also learn how to safely work with chemicals (ie. chlorine). The staff and management make working fun, and engaging. You won't feel like you are going to work but rather going to hang out and have fun with that community. One of the hardest parts of the job was standing in heat for long hours, but rotations help with that. Besides seeing how happy the pool and your activities make the children far outways the negative! Plus the hours are very flexible and can work around your schedule.
pros: fun training weekend and staff events

text: Staff are fun, the pay is great considering how young the lifeguarding staff generally are. Staff trainings can be annoying but with a fun group of staff and management, they can be pretty fun.

Working as a lifeguard for the City of Ottawa provided me with extensive team working skills as well as building my personal leadership skills. My employers and supervisors were always helpful and always supported me and it was a very fun place to work. The staff were amazing.

great place to build a career, with stability and stable income, you know what to expect every day and you know what you will make every pay , you will never be out of work and never worry about not having money for you family
As an employee you have to be very attentive and scanning your classes at all times. You're responsible for the lives of those in your classes.
Strong and friendly team environment, up to date with latest technology, environment, Recognition for Hard Work, a fun open concept atmosphere, and filled with passionate people.

Start it with the city during the summer session. I love it and decide it to stay on for the fall. Depending the pool you work at, it is a little family and teach you how to be confidence on your job. They are very strick on your training has you must stay in shape to be able to do your job well. In services are every months, so if you miss one, you have to find another one to go. The hardest part of the job is to en force the rules. Had to explain even if their child is taking swimming classes, they still need to stay at arms reach has an example (orange bracelet). The program coordinator is there to help you but do what he/she said. 
Other then that, free recert and encourage to get more advanced qualification like NLS instructor or so.
cons: Shift depends on senority, if hired in the summer months and want to work in the fall they have to reactivate you manual

text: Public sector has always been a great place to work. I got wonderful co-workers, seniors and managers. No environment is perfect but it is pretty close to be a perfect. So far so good.
pros: Benefits, Flexible working hours, Good management

text: I to work in an environment where I can get my work done but have in an environment where it is relaxed I like to finish my work by doing one thing at a time. I lie to feel productive in the work and support my fellow co-workers.

- Great people
- Great Culture
- Lots of Employee Growth
- Many Opportunities
- Service Excellence
- Drive to improve the everyday services
- Great to train the Staff

As a typical day at work, everybody is friendly. Work starts at 8. Everyone is willing to give help whenever its needed. Co-workers are friendly as well willing to help as well. The hardest part was when you have to deliver the work on time and you have to pay attention to details at the same time. I liked that we had the lunch hour where we meet different people from different departments and could chat a little bit about life.
cons: The half an hour lunch was unpaid

text:
Fun and energetic work environment, great staff, work was never boring.
Not paid enough for responsibilities, no benefits, and very difficult for advancements.
I got my first summer job with the city of Ottawa, I've learned english, made life time friends and got many opportunities to grow and learn as a worker and supervisor.
pros: Friendly, fun job and great time
cons: late night, too many trainings and long shifts

text:
Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
I would rather you enjoy the experience on your own then me tell you. Great salary and benefits for a life long experience.
helping my worker to organize tasks, prepare meetings, organize the office procedures and make calls to book appointments or to remind clients of their appointements
It was lovely to work for our municipal government and learn how the corporate business services branch help the people of Ottawa
Nothing bad to say here. Easy to get along with co-workers/supervisors. Kids and youth are fun to supervise for the most part.
Best Job I have worked, work was different everyday so it leaves you with excitement for the next day.

I worked with special needs individuals and gained lots of real life experience with the City of Ottawa. This experience is needed for my future long term career with special needs individuals as a Personal Support Worker.
Fantastic treatment of staff, and very gentle and clear on the roles you need to be doing. On top of the training's you need to complete, and supportive for more qualifications.
Busy and much to learn, computer system, policies, added courses, client services, programs and registrations for various courses and memberships and classes in the city.

Management and Job Culture are usually oriented based on the political motives of the group (i.e. cyclist friendly vs. vehicle friendly for example). A lot is not accomplished because of this except when there is a clear mandate from Council to go one way or the other.
Working as a camp coordinator for the City of Ottawa was a great experience. I was able to leave work with a new perspective on social relations and work responsibilities.

Once you're in the City of Ottawa, it is difficult to be gotten rid of. Opportunity for advancement is sometimes there but it is difficult to get in since the starting positions (students) are often given to family members or recommendations by employees.
cons: Union culture (difficult to get rid of bad workers, poor opinion of doing work, etc)

text: Recognized for my experience I appreciated the opportunity given to work in place of a city employee on parental leave.
cons: my placement did not last because it was not a permanent job

text: It was an amazing job financially for an entry level position! I made great money and the benefits were nice.Management is good they always help out and coworkers are friendly and helpful the hardest part is when we are shorthanded and busy.
customer relations such as dispute management, professionalism, interpersonal skills, effective communication skills.

Part time employees are not included in any training that is offered that would help them move into a full-time position.  
Also, any full-time opportunities that arise are difficult to apply for if you are a part-time employee.  
I feel that part-time employees could be treated more fairly and with more respect.
cons: Exclusion from trainings and staff events.

text:
The shift would start with our crew leader planning our route for the day.  We'd fuel up the machines and the truck before leaving the yard.  We'd cut our parks and sports fields until the end of the shift.
My supervisor very knowledgeable.  He took hands-on approach when training us on the lawn tractors and mowers.
The work environment was friendly and upbeat, it made everyday enjoyable.  The full-time workers were great, they kept all the summer students informed and smiling all day.
pros: The work atmosphere was very upbeat and friendly.

text: Always a fun time working, great staff and cliental around. Always learning new things in the fitness world and of the job its self. Management for the department is amazing , great boss. Co-workers are great and always happy. Hardest part is dealing with upper management . Most enjoyable part if actually working with the team.
cons: upper management isnt great and pay

text:
learn to be patient, more understanding. Its a place where you get a reality check make you love your job more and more. You are providing care to another human being. And while you are doing it, you are doing with love, patient, tenderness.
 the hardest part of the Job is not to get attach emotionally for me because I am very emotional.
I truly grounding experience with immense feelings of gratitude and satisfaction. Definitely a memorable experience.
Great hours, great pay, team environment, simple tasks, trainings to keep you sharp. The management is very friendly, helpful, and approachable

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

A typical day at this occupation entailed many different aspects. I worked in teams and individually to trouble shoot and complete tasks.  I had to learn the building systems (operating, troubleshooting etc) to be granted the opportunity of supervisory roles when needed. I was given all the training necessary on issues such as health and safety, working with dangerous materials, working with equipment, and providing customer service. My supervisor is great to work under because he provides hands on training and leads the team from the front. The most enjoyable part of working here are the people I work with, who not only make the job fun, but makes being there enjoyable.
The give you all the resources yo need to improve and better yourself so you can succeed into a successful career with the options of moving from department to department
Was essentially a student inspector, overseeing various projects in construction, and also complete daily dairies of the completed work.

Really great opportunity as a starter job. I enjoyed my time there a lot, it was great to work with a staff compliment who were really committed to their workplace and enjoy what they do. I really appreciated the opportunity for advancement, and I was able to progress into a supervisory role. I've learned a lot about team management in this position.
pros: great hours, very friendly coworkers, supportive management team, opportunity for advancement

text: This was a contract position.  I learned the differences between private and public sector positions.  I was fortunate to have great co-workers.  It definitely makes work more enjoyable.
Very much a team player environment.  Energetic, positive employees and management.    Supportive, encouraging coordinators.    Opportunity to move within the City of Ottawa organization.

easy job but only minimum wage
costumer service experience acquired

This a really fun job with a lot of responsibility. You had to constantly beware of everything that was happening at the park. You gotta like children and playing games. We would order food sometimes when it was someones birthday or something.
pros: Out in the sun all day and get to cool off at the pool if it got too hot.
cons: Draining the water out of the pool.

text: A typical day at work includes opening the facility, greeting members into the facility, answering phones. Addressing any question and registering clients in our programs. Front line work dealing with customers and cashier work. I learned to always have a positive attitude while working and to do my best. The management was fantastic, very easy to work with and accommodating to our school schedule. My co-workers were great and now some of my good friends. The hardest part of the job would be getting to know the City of Ottawa computer operating system, but it didn't take me long to get it! The most enjoyable part of my job is dealing and working with many different people and interacting with them.
Got to experience an office setting and duties for the first time, communicated daily with city councillor's, analyzed and formatted data, programmed and installed collection boards.

I had an amazing experience working with the city, everyone I encountered were very professional and more than helpful in helping me reach the next level. I learned and developed many new skills during my stint within the city. I'm extremely grateful to have had this opportunity while attending university in Ottawa.
pros: meet new people everyday and offered a competitive pay rate
cons: hours were a little scattered even though they were flexible

text: The City of Ottawa has many programs and since the amalgamation, the programs have evolved.  The City of Ottawa Aquatic programs are highly competitive and have gained national standing.

A fun work place with flexible hours and supportive staff. 
 working with kids from different background and culture was the most enjoyable part.The was a lot of different stuff to do each, witch it interesting and give you the motivation to come to work everyday. The company is very culturally diverse.

Awesome, like i really enjoyed my job i'm hoping to return for more 
summers to come. Its an all around fun experience to play with kids 
and prepare activities for the community. I couldn't ask for a better 
job.
Great! I loved working at the Sandy Hill Community Centre and I learned many professional skills during my nearly 6 years there. I was part of a large family and we helped each other out.
Working with the city of ottawa was a great experience. Hard work from 7 am till 5 pm. Pay was worth the long hours and hard work. Crew was great and so was he enviroment.

A typical day for me at work is logging on to my computer and going through my emails! I list the ones that require immediate attention and are considered a priority. I then listen to my voice messages, respond if possible or gather the information and call back. I also review  my Outlook calendar for notifications and meetings booked. 
Then it's the "to do folder" I created. Ths is to list any outstanding tasks to complete . It's a pleasure to put a red line through tasks that are completed. 
The most enjoyable part of the job is getting work done in a timely manner. I plan in advance and organize my day well. Of course, there are always surprises and the expectation to respond to all inquiries within 24 hours. 
The hardest part of the job, is getting external or internal responses to enquires. I have no control in getting replies. However I ensure I do follow-ups or always have an alternative person to contact.
My co-workers are great. We work as a team. Assisting each other in all aspects of the job. For days off or vacation time, we act as the cover off for that person. It's important to work well with colleagues, to share work load  and be a source of knowledge that  I am willing to share.
If it's a quiet day, I do my filing!

- Usually busy and fast paced work environment.
- I enjoyed working with people and getting their mail and parcels to the correct location in a reasonable time frame.
- I learned how to handle mail and use a machine to stamp outgoing mail.
- I learned how to operate a loading dock.
Typical day at work:
-2 mail runs
-Helping customers with internal and outgoing mail and parcels
-Help receive a truck and let them unload and direct them to right floor and section.

A typical day here is very stressful for we provide public transit for the city of Ottawa, And making service can be tough we have mechanical issues and driver issues and weather issues to contend with, Just to mention a few.
Co-workers are great and the hardest part of the job is that you can't please everybody and that you can't fix everything as much as you try and as much as you want to, It gets frustrating.
The most enjoyable part of the job is knowing you were part of a team that did a job well done and made service and no one was injured and everyone had a great shift.
pros: There's a full gym on site and we get a free bus pass

text:
I've been with the City part time for 8 years, at the same complex!
The daily interactions with clients, is the best part of the job. 
The senior clientèle are the best part of my day.
cons: Hard to advance/get a higher title job within the City.

text:
Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there
I loved every minute of working for Parks and the City. I'm sad to go. This job taught me patience and that working towards the happiness of others makes me happy.
A nice as a startup job. I liked it but I am looking forward to more fashion or fitness related job. I learned a lot there and my Training helped me a lot to deal with kids and people.

Over see the workings of City of Ottawa Parks. Open the wading pool. Clean up the wading pool area, park and structure areas. Duties include; hosing pool, raking sand area, picking up garbage, swept pool and surrounding areas. Guarding pool, ensuring all the children in the wading pool were safely playing and having an enjoyable time. Working with staff, supervising staff, filling in schedules, ensuring pay sheet was filled out, as well as daily log. Meeting new children that come to park every day was exciting, creating a friendship and relationship with the patrons on the park. Sometimes challenging with some children on the park, but main thing was to keep patrons on the park happy and ensure that they are safe while at the park.

Park Programmer is a awesome job for some one who loves and enjoys kids, the outdoors, and being creative. Your day consists of cleaning up the park in the morning and filling up the pool.Then life guarding and creating fun activities for the kids to enjoy. Then ending the day with emptying the pool before locking up for the day. Overall great job to spend your summer working and you get to meet a lot of great people as well!
cons: Weather conditions effect if you work that day.

text: Great work environment. Attended programs at this facility when I was younger. Many senior staff members. Close knit employees. Keep client's best interests in mind.

1) A typical day of work is consisting on inspecting the work implemented at site, helping contractors in accelerating their work as much as possible within specification and drawings.
2) I have learned many skills such as MS Project software, reading construction drawings in details.  
3) Management people at my work are very friendly people, i can ask them any question anytime in order to clarify my information.  They Keep asking if i have any problems basically they are very close to their employees.
pros: getting the employees involved in companies accomplishments

text: The City of Ottawa is an incredible opportunity for anyone looking for a job in a fun, and dynamic setting with great staff.

•	Developing and implementing  the program
•	Planning, monitoring and evaluating the direct involvement of the program 
•	Site coordination, supervision, direction of participant, cash handling, customer services, risk management procedures and general administrative tasks.
•	Work collaboratively with other staff to deliver efficient and effective services

The day begins with the children coming to the facility. We then set up the activities for the day during their free play. It may be a craft, baking or a game. We organize the activity so that every thing runs smoothly. I've learnt that children are very demanding and require a lot of attention and management. My co-workers are great and it is easy to work with them. The hardest part of the job would be the amount of attention that each child requires. The most enjoyable part of the job is when you see the children smiling and loving the program so much that they don't want to leave.
Working for the City of Ottawa is rewarding and a great place to build a career.The city offers training to build on new skills to advance within the corporation.

Assisted the workers at social services for clients files or records.
Entered information into the database, filed away client files when workers was done with file. Answered client questions and concerns. Worked with a great team of people
A typical day at work including guarding the pool while the children were at play, and then when you rotated with your co-workers, you played with the children in the field.

I enjoy my every day work at City of Ottawa. There is a good management and nice facility. There is a good opportunity to get valuable experience and build future career. Currently I am a part-time worker and I think I have enough experience to apply rof a ful-time position.
cons: not enough hours to fil my day

text:
I enjoyed working for The City of Ottawa, unfortunately my hours were cut and I am now seeking other employment.
I was a cleaner, worked all shifts, mostly nights at the pool.
Ability to upgrade skills and knowledge to coordinate the best position to ensure longevity in a position and provide quality support to the customer.
Worked in a team oriented environment. Normal clerical duties. Assisted with project management. Great customer service experience.
Since I begin the day early each day, starting to work at 6.00 a.m was perfect for me and my lifestyle.I thoroughly enjoyed working for the city of Ottawa

As a City Councillor each day held a new challenge, and filled with diverse requirements and projects. As a key decision maker in the City it was critical to understand all the projects affecting the ward I represented as well as City-wide projects like Light Rail, new developments, development of new parks, building new roads or sewers.There was not a day that was not interesting. Although I worked most evenings and weekends at events and meetings, it was an enjoyable and rewarding term of government and I achieved a number of significant accomplishments.

A typical day would include driving to various location sites to perform landscaping duties which for my division included cutting grass on pathways. Some of the most important things I learned while working was a greater understanding and comprehension of the French language, as most of my co-workers spoke french. Another important aspect were the required training programs made available such as occupational work safety, work harassment, and other training programs related. These courses explained work regulations and work hazards. The hardest part of the day was working in somewhat exhaustive heat throughout the summer. The most enjoyable parts of the day was ironically working outside, because being able to spend summer outside while working has its benefits but also its cons.
Great place to work, staff is very friendly... why do i have to write this, seriously i dont care.. this is pointless

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

The job of being a Lifeguard requires
- on going learning and teaching opportunities. 
- There is an expectation that each individual is to work as a team in high stress situations 
- Weekly Monthly an yearly practice and certify qualifications.
- Learn a lot about life saving, pool maintenance, paper work, community involvement and much more.
pros: Great Pay, Fun and active, Work with others in team buliding excercises
cons: Constantly teaching in cold water, chlorine rashes, clean possible vomit, etc (pool follwings)

text: I like my current job with the city, however, it provides awful hours. I work every week day morning for an hour and a half and then work afternoons. Split shifts are not ideal for me, as I am currently attending college and playing varsity soccer.

Very enjoyable workplace, working with children is extremely fun and rewarding. All the staff are great people and it continues to be a great experience. No two days are the same, and while some children's disputes can be challenging to resolve at times, it gives a deep sense that you're making a difference in their lives.

As a lifeguard with the City of Ottawa, I have it relatively easy.
I work at a quiet pool, with a simple task set, and a fair number of swimming lesson blocks.
I really enjoy how structured and precise everything is. There is always a plan for everything, and the answers to any question you may have is just simple to find.
The one thing that I don't necessarily enjoy is the management style. At my pool, the PC's office is located within the lifeguard room, separated by a few filing cabinets and nothing more. The level of micro-managing that occurs is difficult to handle at times. 
The pros are numerous. I enjoy teaching higher-level swimming lessons, so I had a few really good blocks of lessons including Swim Kids 8/9/10, and PowerSwim. Teaching these classes is great because the Head Guards provide a strong support and are available as a ready reference whenever you need. 
Overall, I've enjoyed my time at the City.
cons: Management team is uncooperative within itself

text:
As a lifeguard with the City of Ottawa, I have learned many valuable skills that can be applied in the workforce. I have learned how to work as a team and how to work with little supervision. As a lifeguard, team work is essential, as the facility is large and many lifeguards are working together to ensure the facility is safe. I also learned advanced first aid skills, included how to operate an AED machine and oxygen tanks. 
As a head lifeguard, a typical day includes setting up the facility, ensuring my staff are performing their responsibilities, responding to public relations, opening and closing the cash, closing the facility, and writing daily reports. As a head lifeguard, I would say the hardest part about my job is balancing work and personal life. As the head lifeguard, I am responsible for the entire facility and my staff. This can be very time consuming and I often find it difficult to allow myself personal time and activities while not at work. The most enjoyable part of my job is working in a great community and getting to know the patrons on a personal level.

i love that job, learned a lot their.
very helpful, nice employee.
The work in the public sector is quite different compared to the private sector.
Good management, team-oriented environment. Good benefits package.

The City of Ottawa Recreation and Culture department is a workplace of opportunity. Over the course of 9 years working for the city, I've had the pleasure of working with a variety of co-workers and volunteers. The work environments in recreation are very dynamic, challenging, and rewarding. The most enjoyable part of my jobs has been making people feel happier, safer, and knowing that they are the getting value they want.

I really enjoy the camaraderie between all the employees and that they really tried to involve the student even if we are only there for a short amount of time. My bosses have always been very easy-going and made sure that the road work we were doing was safe.
Although it was difficult to get to work as I lived far from the recreation, it was quite enjoyable to play and teach the children who were enthusiastic.
Met a lot of great people and learned a lot while working with the City of Ottawa. Very laid back but professional environment.
Great time, better people! I loved getting everyone together playing, and if you enjoy playing hockey and getting paid. I highly reccemond it!
This is a great job for a student, you are provided with a fun environment and management offers many ways for advancement if you're a dedicated employee.
cons: cap on the hours available to work

text: A typical day consisted of going out with electricians to repair broken lights and electrical equipment at various parks and recreational facilities all across Ottawa.

I got to the rink and first I shoveled all of the snow that was on it off with either a shovel or snow blower. I then brought all the equipment on too the ice such as hockey nets and I made sure at all times that everyone was in a safe environment. I was always the only one working during my shift. The ahrdest part of the job was the cold days as it was hard to complete all my tasks because i was so cold. The most enjoyable part of the job was being able to watch other people enjoy the ice that i helped maintain
Good place to learn about the construction industry. This was a great opportunity to understand the importance of communication and project management.
this employment was many of first jobs that was profitable such as being unionized, receiving good long hours, and more.
It was a great place to work. City of Ottawa gave me a secure part time job with excellent benefits as well as a great pay.

Would start off by setting up before the bell ran for school to be over. I would take attendance while kids start to pile in. I would then go over the schedule for the day with the counsellors and get activities set up. It would then become circle time. Circle time is for telling all the kids of any new rules and what the plans were for the day. We would then do one activity and after would be snack. After snack we would then go into the gym for a running game. After the gym it is free time for the kids that haven't been picked up yet. I would then write in the log book about the day, who was working, and what activities we played. After the kids are gone, we would clean up, and sign our hours.
The hardest part of my job is making all the kids happy. There are different ages so there are many suggestions for different games. I try my best compromise for everyone. 
I love going into work because the kids just brighten my day. They are so entertaining and love being around them.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

I worked with another student under the supervision of an inspector on water main sites. I won't name him but he was very bitter and difficult to work for and due for retirement.  The city seems to have a lot of redundant positions and this seemed like one of them.  I stood outside all day watching contractors work and writing notes, and standing around basically just making sure contractor would do work as specified by the city.  Boss would bug me about not doing anything when there was literally nothing for me to do.  I did learn a lot just from watching the watermain construction since I knew nothing about construction going in.  We had no field office for most of the summer so the rainy and cold days were sometimes rough. Overall though, it wasn't to terrible.  Time went by slow most of the time but at least it wasn't too stressful.
pros: Relaxing, easy job, good intro to construction, decent pay for a student
cons: Stand outside all day, bad management

text: Coaching children to adults in the day time programs with The City of Ottawa
I really enjoy working for the city. But unable to continue in my career due to medical reasons.

- Typical day starts at 7:30 AM
- I have enjoyed my career starting at the City of Ottawa.
- Welcoming staff
pros: Hours of work, Benefits, Salary, Overtime

text: At the City of Ottawa RSS there are no typical days. Each day/class is different, and that's what makes the job so enjoyable. You could be teaching children or adults, or anywhere in between. The most enjoyable part of the job was definitely the people I worked with.

I was resposnsible for doing changes and corrections to designs that are up for review. I would come to the office and have drawings on my table ready to be corrected. I complete them and take them back for further review and corrections. Worked on multiple projects at one time and for multiple designers. Co-workers were great though! Everyone supported eachother and helped eachother when ever possible. Great team work! I loved coming in and helping the designers and others with work and seeing that i had a part to do in accomplishing a project. The hardest part of my job must have was cordinating everything. At first it was a little difficult to layout my time for which project but once I got to know how everything runs, I was able to do that part much better and easier.
Start the day at 7 & and end at 3:30. Great working outdoors and with good happy co workers.

A typical day at work involves meticulous cleaning and building maintenance, as well as normal operation of rental set-ups, ice resurfacing and assistance to customers.  
I have learned a lot of valuable life lessons working for the City of Ottawa, such as managing work load, and improvement of customer service.
My co-workers are all very nice and have the same intentions as i do when it comes to work. They also have very good communication skills.
pros: good pay, good hours, amazing boss

text: Amazing management. Very relaxed atmosphere and some very cool projects to work on.

Volunteer work thought me a lot of things, I didn't only do this because I had to complete my 40 hours with school but I did it because I wanted responsibility, working on a outdoor rinks demands a lot of time and effort from the maintenance of the ice to the on ice discipline this volunteer work made me a better person.
I enjoyed going to my clients homes and interacting with them on a weekly or bi weekly basis.
pros: seeing the apreciation on clients faces

text: It is very good to me part of my team. I need more hours to work.

In a typical day I would support my team. Fast paced environment which offered challenges in frequent operational changes to deal with day to day demands.  
I learned a great deal about managing and supporting my team.

It was my first job working with a group of children. 
The program was diversified, some days I worked with a English group and other day I worked with the French group.
I learned to use my imagination to create news games. We even had a "World Cup Soccer Competition" during the 2010 games.
I learned how to enter data in SAP for invoice payment of various types, etc. As a team player with strong interpersonal skills, I can work well under pressure and with tight deadlines.

I feel like that I am the luckiest person to have enjoy work for all those years.
The last 10 years were with management -7 staffs and being in charge of the whole operation of a daycare with 35 childrens
The hardest part of the job was to keep staff satisfied.
The best part was to see our clientele adult and children happy
If you are not from the city and have no connection to senior management socially, you will be set apart particularly in the Public Works group

Very large department , friendly and very helpful associates.
