Meetings are short and interesting.

I really got to demonstrate my creativity when i worked on the radio ads, bus inserts and newsletters. I enjoyed the position.I got to educate the public both young and old on water efficiency. I attended public events and also helped coordinate them!

4 hour days
How to paint on "concrete" and what products are available
Excellent management
Super co-workers
The heat!
Expressing myself artistically
pros: was able to express my artistic talent, very social environment, fun!
cons: we had to work outside during a "heatwave."

text:
Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

A typical day at work would be providing customer service to tourists. As well as ensuring cleanliness of assigned areas. I learnt a lot while working with the City of Ottawa. I got to meet new people everyday, I got to deal with different kinds of people, and I got to realize that our environment is getting extremely polluted. Working with my co-workers was an amazing experience. This summer program was a pilot program in which 8 students were hired therefore we all had a lot in common. The hardest part of the job was having to deal with homeless people downtown because they would always yell horrible things at us. The most enjoyable part of the job was helping and guiding people to their destination.
More great people to work with. Had some great times and laughs. Still in touch with a couple of people.

This job requires five days a week with potential for weekend shifts. I provide up to three to one care with children with special needs in an after school program setting. It is very well organized and a constant learning experience. The environment is very well rounded and with excellent and amicable co-workers. The hardest part of the job is balancing my attention between the three children. Each day they all show up in different moods and need different attention. For example: one is diabetic and needs more attention health wise where as another has more behavioral issues. The most enjoyable part of this job is seeing the children grow and progress.
This job was a great experience. I experienced real work environments, worked with people I may never have in other situations and gained valuable skills I will carry into my next job
Worked at my own pace, but hade certain milestones to achieve.
A well run, informative environment. Employees are knowledgeable and willing to help their co-workers.

This was quite possibly the best work experience I had. The LRT staff was very knowledgeable and supportive. Tasks and responsibilities were assigned based on experience. There was a very rich work culture and social environment with frequent social gatherings for team building. All in all, an excellent position!
pros: excellent co-workers, frequent social gatherings, laid back environment

text:
Great hours and great support
you chose your typical day at work
you are always learning from others
management is great
my co-workers are great
the hardest part of the job is dealing with complaints
the most enjoyable part of the job is seeing people progress in swimming

Driving and take care of the person i pick up make sure and are tie down propely if they used a wheelchair.
the most enjoyable part is i know i did a good day when they thank me for the ride and the ear i gave them.
the hard part is to go and pick up the person and they tell you she pass away.

Operating buses on route, serving the public with safe transportation and timely information.
Service to the public is its own reward. A driver typically gets treated as well as he treats commuters. First you may have to endure the initial encounter, not take it personally, and rise above the complaints, then respect will be returned.
Selection of managers was always questionable, there was no apparent lick between qualifications, duties and abilities. Qualified candidates are often overlooked, appointed candidate often totally incompetent. The primary skill sought appears to be the ability to deflect responsibility onto subordinates.
Bus drivers are service oriented people, they often become dis-enchanted with the lack of support, lack of needed training and lack of consistency in the application of guidelines. Obvious favoritism creates distrust, the dominate attitude at OC Transpo.
Dealing with supervisors who push for dervice delivery at the expense of safety. Motivating yourself when the management has alterior motives, hiden agendas, and aggressive and disrespectful tendencies towards the front line workers.
The many smiles on customers faces, friendships developed after years of service and satisfaction with knowing I performed to the best of my ability despite management.
pros: paid well for the task performed.
cons: paid poorly for the abuse tolerated from the supervisors.

text: Lots of hard work was put in to every day of work in planning and implementing the camp programs and it was paid off to see the campers enjoying every activity. Building relationships was a fundamental part of this job in terms of coworkers, local businesses, campers, and their parents.

Upheld excellent customer service to customers on behalf of city of Ottawa
Ensured a clear understanding on delivery of efficiency regarding meters
Troubleshooted wiring problems
Perfect atmosphere, great place to work. Opportunities for advancement are reachable. Great place to balance family and work.

A typical day at work would be having to put Chlorine into the pool 3-5 times a day (everytime by a different co-worker). We would also make crafts with the patrons, play football in the field, and do activities in the pool. My co-workers were friendly and enthusiastic. We managed through the day well. Some days would be very relaxed with barely any patrons. Other days would be busy with camps coming in.The hardest part of the job would be cleaning the scum line from the pool walls. The most enjoyable part would pretty much be everything else!
Excellent place to work .Fell like you are working with company not for company

In a typical day, I would go out with a crew of 3 other people and help them. We could travel to various locations in Ottawa. I would help clean up when they prunned / removed trees from City property.
During my time with the City, I learned that I like an environment that changes from day to day. More so, we were outside , which gave me the opportunity to see many animals during the day.
cons: sometimes lots of time spent in the truck getting to each location.

text: Amazing staff, rewarding work, hard to get full time but it's understandable.

This was my favourite job. I would get home from school, and head over to work where I would be meet with my great manager and front desk staff. All the staff members there were amazing, friendly, energetic and kind. After a short time I would take off to pick up the other school of kids down the road. Myself and usually three other councillors would walk with the kids down the side walk and across a road to get to the centre. Once we got there the kids would all head to the gym to get told what the activities were for the day. (Craft, Gym, Homework Room & Circle games). From there each councillor would take a group of kids to do there activity and wait for the parents to arrive, keeping to the 10-1 ratios of kids to councillors.
The hardest part of the job would be coming up with craft ideas being a guy I tended to prefer gym so craft was not my strong suit. Most of the time I would get by with fun crafts that the kids enjoyed.
The most enjoyable part of the job was the ability to feel satisfied with my job and know that I was doing my part in the community I lived in.

On a typical day at work I travel between many different job sites around Ottawa doing sewer and water main inspections. I have learned alot about infrastructure development which can only be gained through experience. I work along side of the contractor and my supervisor to ensure all the work is completed correctly and promtly.
You arrive at least 15 min. Hang around with coworkers, chat for a bit, get changed, then start guarding. Rotations are very 15 min. Everyone gets along very easily.

Good place to work. balance work- life experience
Good potential to achieve your goals. Nice people to work with...
Good working environment 
I am happy to be EE there

The work was fairly repetitive however my co-workers were very friendly offering insights and a positive work environment. The position offered me the importance of a structured schedule and accuracy in data entry.
pros: introduced me to the payroll department and required tasks

text: Tought kids how to skate and play hockey, cleaned up the shack afterwards, shovelled the ice when needed.
I worked as a records clerk.We were 6 employees in records office.We were called in boardroom .we got pink slips.It was bad management.very bad timing for me.
Meet with the supervisor in the morning for and update on the clients. Share a morning snack with very supportive co workers. learn various ways to approach given tasks.

It was great working for the City of Ottawa as I learned many skills on the job. I focused on collecting beach samples at various beaches across the city for further water testing of e-coli and total coliforms. It was a wonderful summer job experience
